aboutUs.title: About Us
aboutUs.desc-1: ANLU is an ancestral practice of the Kom community in the North-West of Cameroon. It is a practice with which women acted to bring justice against transgressions of the social order. Thus, our library aims to be a space of encounter, knowledge sharing and learning that will contribute to questioning our individual and common relationship to history in order to make us proud African citizens.
aboutUs.desc-3: - To promote African thoughts and perspectives through the African cultural and intellectual heritage;
aboutUs.desc-4: - to involve young people in the African intellectual debate on Africa, to decolonise the collective memory;
aboutUs.desc-5: - to build with African youth a free African society independent of neo-colonialism.

wsPortal.title: Welcome to Anlu Bibliothèque Workshop!
wsPortal.desc: Anlu Bibliothèque located in Cameroon. Locally, we provide book and transfer knowledge to locals. For our friends around the world, we've set up this online library with our book and knowledge collection so we can share our love for miniatures with you!

donation.title: Donation Guide
donation.desc-1: Thank you for your interest in our project!
donation.desc-2: To support our project, please make a deposit via Mobile Money to this number 00237 652 07 74 45.
donation.desc-3: It is thanks to the support of people like you that we are active. Thank you for your support!
